snippet: Footage showed a 38-year-old black man being shocked by a Taser and dragged down a jail hallway by officers in 2012. The man, Philip Coleman, later died.
abstract: Chicago Police Dept releases video showing black man Philip Coleman being shocked by Taser and dragged down hallway by officers in 2012; Coleman later died at hospital, allegedly of allergic reaction to medication, but family has stated they believe he died as result of multiple shocks; Mayor Rahm Emanuel issues strong rebuke of officers' treatment of Coleman.
lead_paragraph: Footage showed a 38-year-old black man being shocked by a Taser and dragged down a jail hallway by officers in 2012. The man, Philip Coleman, later died.

headline.main: New Chicago Police Video Prompts Rebuke From Mayor Rahm Emanuel
headline.print_headline: Latest Video From Chicago Police Prompts Harsh Rebuke by Mayor
